item.title: Report X-2024090600
item.description:
Report X-2024090600

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-13T09:14:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-03
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 3rd a package was discovered during a basic package inspection process that contained batteries. There were no markings on the outside of the package indicating a battery was inside.After opening the package it was discovered that it contained a drill and 2 lithium ion batteries that powered the drill. The package is being held pending disposition.

item.title: Report E-2024090167
item.description:
Report E-2024090167

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-13T09:14:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-14
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 1/4-gallons of ZEP CON IND PURPLE DEGREASER released from a plastic jug due to improper loading. The release impacted inside of trailer #3110137. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller who felt comfortable cleaning the release with the available PPE onsite.

item.title: Report E-2024090132
item.description:
Report E-2024090132

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-12T09:14:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-09
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that a 1-gallon poly jug of UN3266 Meyer Component P was crushed due to a faulty pallet from the shipper causing approximately 1-quart to release on the dock. The damaged jug and absorbents were placed into a 55-gallon poly drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024090128
item.description:
Report E-2024090128

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-12T09:14:10+00:00

  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 2-tablespoons of GE Locomotive flushing solvent released from a metal tote due to the tote lid being loose. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller who felt comfortable tightening the lid and cleaning the release with the available PPE onsite.
